author: samuraiturtle
title: The Alien Wizard
review:
The LEGO company must like "Video Games".  Because I can see this guy in multiply settings, not only in a "space" setting but also a "castle / fantasy" setting as well.  Just like you would in a "Video Game".  All you need to put him in a "castle" setting is change the body and weapon and presto a "mind-flayer" (or whatever species you want them to be).  

Looking at the body printing it looks like he could be a back -up "Nova Corps Person" with the yellow dots in the torso.  Looking at the "gun" you can get more like them from "The LEGO Movie" sets off the "robot cops" (all you need to do is add a "radar dish" to the "gun").  Personally, I like to think the "gun" is a "sonic cannon".  

If you use the feel method to find this guy.  I would feel for the "radar dish".  It is easiest to find and he is the only guy in this series that comes with one.

author: pagani88
title: Another Epic Alien!
review:
When I first saw images of series 13 CMFs, This one was my clear favorite, because I love collecting Aliens. And he looks like Dr John Zoidberg.

Box/Instructions

The standard CMF mystery bag fare, light green this time with eight of the sixteen minifigs to collect pictured on the front. In the top right is a "collect and win" sign and along the bottom is some writing in different languages. The back has more writing and a barcode. No instructions for this series, the collectors sheet has an advert for something on their website on it's reverse side where you can apparently enter a code and win things. Doesn't tell you what things.

Parts

6 parts: The stand, the trans neon green radar dish (which isn't too common) the new gun with clip in dark blueish gray (as of writing this review that piece can only be found here, the Jurassic World sets and the Lego Movie sets) and the parts for the minifigure.

Minifigures

Of course, just this Alien Trooper. The radar dish is attached to the front of the gun (presumably to make it look like a stun blaster or something)which he holds. His torso is medium azure I think, and has darker blue armor around the top of his torso which has a little control panel thing at the bottom and 3 yellow orbs above that. Lower down on his torso is some purple detailing. This detailing is also on the back of the torso along with a continuation of his armor. Also on the back is a blue rectangle with detailing that looks like it could be a vent. He has light green hands and arms that are the same colour as his torso.
 The legs are medium azure too, with a blue waist. On the waist are three small yellow orbs. He has some more blue armour printed on the top of his legs and a bit more purple detailing that looks like padding on his knees. His head is a big, light green slightly rubbery piece with blue eyes, four tentacles instead of a mouth and some green spots. And of course, he has the usual black stand. Like I said, he looks like a green Zoidberg.

The build

Won't be challenging anyone. I don't think I need to explain it.

The completed model

Just explained that.

Overall opinion

This is a great minifigure and will look good on display or attacking Lego City. Or being a bad doctor with an awful understanding of human anatomy if that's how you want it. I recomend this to lovers of minifigs, aliens and Futurama.

author: Odeinoichus
title: BEWARE the ALIENS FROM THE THIRD DIMENSION!
review:
Set #71008 Alien Trooper: These days the closest we get to more Classic Space inspired characters is in the CMF line, there is no dedicated Space Theme from LEGO and haven't been since Galaxy Squad. So it's nice to see these figures to help populate a Space Display.

The Alien Trooper uses a nice medium hue blue for his torso and legs, not exactly light, but not too dark either. His torso is printed double-sided with an awesome looking padded space suit with a pattern that is slightly familiar, three smaller dots circling a larger one, it's almost the symbol for Brainiac, though not quite. His legs have padded printing on his knees and some printing for his belt.

The head is a softer plastic which is quite rubbery, similar to most of the Simpsons heads. It's got a nice alien look to it with tentacles falling down where a mouth might be. He's also got some nice printing of a spotted pattern on his head. His accessory is a standard LEGO tranquilizer gun with a dish attached making a nice ray gun.

Overall this minifigure is really impressive, a lot of folks have likened it to a certain horror creature from Lovecraft, personally I just like the overall look of him. And his torso has some potential reuse. Recommended in large quantities and if you missed out on him before he'd definitely look great with the rest of the Space CMF figures.

author: sideswinger
title: an Intergalactic Gem!
review:
Many tropes have been overutilized in the CMF line, if you ask me, with multiple characters revolving around the same general concept. Even in 2015, space-themed figures were becoming repetitive, and Series 13 did nothing to change that, since 2 are included, the first of which is the Alien Trooper, who retailed for 4 dollars at launch.

Obviouly the most intriguing part of this figure is his big ol' head piece, which was a completely new mould made exclusively for this figure. That head is caste in soft rubber, which I personally don't have a problem with, but I guess it is more prone to damage. The tentacles are nice touches, but the printed pattern atop the head is what really interests me. It's a very well done sculpt, all things considered.

The torso for this alien has more impressive detail, like the yellow bulb and the purple stomach. Shockingly, all those designs are carried onto the back, which is a touch I wouldn't expect to see, but is definitely appreciated. The legs continue the purple accents, but sadly, no side printing is incorporated.

His accessory is honestly pretty weak, but considering that wacky head sculpt, I am glad one was included at all. It was not a new gun mould, but rather, it's the typical tranquilizer piece often used in Jurassic World, but in this instance, a trans-yellow radar dish is pegged into the tip to create a radar gun. This accessory does its job nicely!

Overall, while I'm not the biggest fan of LEGO space minifigures, I can't lie and say I dislike this figure. If he didn't use a new head sculpt, he'd be about a 3, maybe even a 2. But his exclusive head bumps him up to a solid 4 out of 5. I'm pleased with this figure!
